attributes.title: Stock Count
attributes.description:
·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 21 Feb 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- (-719.50 loaves)

Ø  Yeast-      (-7.8 kg)

Ø  Utto- (-18.2 kg)

Ø  Polybags-  (+637 pieces)

Ø  Crates-   (-9)

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        The management to ensure that proper accountability of production damages is done and goods issue passed for genuine damages due to production issues.

value: The bread shortfall has been recovered and corrective measures taken to ensure that anomalies do not recur in future.
A cumulative shortfall of 39 loaves and polybags variance of -187 pieces was reported in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description:
·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        All sample varieties had few cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 12%, 400g W- 03%, 400g BT- 08% and 600g BT- 0%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained.

value: We will continue making improvements
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
·        Analysis of bread damages from 20.01.25 – 20.02.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 1,898.5 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.25% of the total loaves produced.

·        1,403 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.19% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.

·        On the spot check day, physical damages weigh indicated that there was 41 kg (102.5 loaves) excess bread damages that was not recorded.

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The effective controls should be maintained

value: Effective controls will be maintained.
Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.
·        Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis
attributes.description:
·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 20.01.25 – 20.02.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material usage.

·        No significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.

value: No variances was reported in the previous audit findings.
Production standards were observed.

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description:
·        The branch hired a total of 815 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 3,668 bags.

·        The actual production was 3,803 bags leading to an actual efficiency of 4.67 bags per worker.

·        The set efficiency was achieved

 

Production efficiency

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
·        The total converted bread produced over the audited period is 55,193 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 569 workers.

·        A total of 578 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 95.5 crates per worker which is slightly below the target.

·        Extra 9 packers were hired over the audit period and the set packaging efficiency was not achieved.
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to improve on the planning of slicing and packaging workers to ensure that the set packaging efficiency is consistently achieved.

value: Packaging efficiency was attained in the previous findings
e set packaging efficiency was not achieved indicating that the planned packaging cost was exceeded by Ksh. 8,208

attributes.title: Cash count
attributes.description:
·        A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch cash was well maintained.

No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
